org.ros.actionlib.client
Class SimpleActionClient<T_ACTION_FEEDBACK extends Message,T_ACTION_GOAL extends Message,T_ACTION_RESULT extends Message,T_FEEDBACK extends Message,T_GOAL extends Message,T_RESULT extends Message>

Direct Known Subclasses:
FibonacciSimpleActionClient
public class SimpleActionClient<T_ACTION_FEEDBACK extends Message,T_ACTION_GOAL extends Message,T_ACTION_RESULT extends Message,T_FEEDBACK extends Message,T_GOAL extends Message,T_RESULT extends Message>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ActionClientCallbacks<T_ACTION_FEEDBACK,T_ACTION_GOAL,T_ACTION_RESULT,T_FEEDBACK,T_GOAL,T_RESULT>

A SimpleActionClient is a wrapper around a regular ActionClient that hides the more complex mechanisms from the user. It allows to pursue exactly one goal. If a new goal is sent out before the current one was finalized, the current goal does not get canceled but tracking of this goal is stopped. If the current goal shall be canceled, one of the cancelGoal-methods have to be called.

This client must be started by using the # method.

Constructor Detail

SimpleActionClient

public SimpleActionClient(java.lang.String nameSpace,
                          ActionSpec<?,T_ACTION_FEEDBACK,T_ACTION_GOAL,T_ACTION_RESULT,T_FEEDBACK,T_GOAL,T_RESULT> spec)
                   throws RosException
Constructor used to create a SimpleActionClient that will be a child node of the node represented by the given node handle. It communicates in a given nodeName space on a given action specification. An extra thread that services the callbacks may be demanded.

Parameters:
nameSpace - The nodeName space to communicate within (specified by the action server)
spec - The specification of the action the SimpleActionClient shall use
Throws:
RosException - If setting up the needed subscribers and publishers fail
Method Detail

addClientPubSub

public void addClientPubSub(Node node)
Add all actionclient publishers and subscribers to the given node.

Lifetime of the node is taken over by the client.

Parameters:
node -

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Shut the client down.

sendGoal

public void sendGoal(T_GOAL goal)
              throws RosException
Sends a goal message to the action server without demanding callback methods which would enable the user to track the progress of the goal. If there is another active goal currently being worked on by the server, tracking of that goal stops without canceling it.

Parameters:
goal - A goal message
Throws:
RosException

sendGoal

public void sendGoal(T_GOAL goal,
                     SimpleActionClientCallbacks<T_FEEDBACK,T_RESULT> callbacks)
              throws RosException
Sends a goal message to the action server demanding callback methods which enable the user to track the progress of the goal. If there is another active goal currently being worked on by the server, tracking of that goal stops without canceling it.

Parameters:
goal - A goal message
callbacks - The user's callback methods
Throws:
RosException
See Also:
SimpleActionClientCallbacks.activeCallback(), SimpleActionClientCallbacks.doneCallback(SimpleClientGoalState, Message), SimpleActionClientCallbacks.feedbackCallback(Message)

sendGoalAndWait

public SimpleClientGoalState sendGoalAndWait(T_GOAL goal,
                                             long execTimeout,
                                             java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit execUnits,
                                             long preemptTimeout,
                                             java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit preemptUnits)
                                      throws RosException,
                                             java.lang.InterruptedException
Uses the sendGoal(Message) method to send out the given goal and then waits for the result using the #waitForResult(Duration) method. If no result was received within the specified duration the goal gets canceled and the SimpleActionClient waits up to the specified duration for the action server's acknowledgment.

Parameters:
goal - A goal message
execTimeout - The maximum duration that the SimpleActionClient is going to wait for a result before canceling the goal. A zero length duration results in unlimited waiting.
preemptTimeout - The maximum duration that the SimpleActionClient is going to wait for the action server's acknowledgment after canceling the goal. A zero length duration results in unlimited waiting.
Returns:
The latest goal state
Throws:
RosException
java.lang.InterruptedException

sendGoalAndWait

public SimpleClientGoalState sendGoalAndWait(T_GOAL goal,
                                             long execTimeout,
                                             java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit execUnits,
                                             long preemptTimeout,
                                             java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit preemptUnits,
                                             SimpleActionClientCallbacks<T_FEEDBACK,T_RESULT> callbacks)
                                      throws RosException,
                                             java.lang.InterruptedException
Uses the sendGoal(Message, SimpleActionClientCallbacks) method to send out the given goal and then waits for the result using the #waitForResult(Duration) method. If no result was received within the specified duration the goal gets canceled and the SimpleActionClient waits up to the specified duration for the action server's acknowledgment. The demanded callback methods get called on certain circumstances enabling the user to track the progress of the goal.

Parameters:
goal - A goal message
execTimeout - The maximum duration that the SimpleActionClient is going to wait for a result before canceling the goal. A zero length duration results in unlimited waiting.
preemptTimeout - The maximum duration that the SimpleActionClient is going to wait for the action server's acknowledgment after canceling the goal. A zero length duration results in unlimited waiting.
callbacks - The user's callback methods
Returns:
The latest goal state
Throws:
RosException
java.lang.InterruptedException
See Also:
SimpleActionClientCallbacks.activeCallback(), SimpleActionClientCallbacks.doneCallback(SimpleClientGoalState, Message), SimpleActionClientCallbacks.feedbackCallback(Message)

                throws RosException

RosException

cancelGoalsAtAndBeforeTime

public void cancelGoalsAtAndBeforeTime(Time time)
Cancels the execution of all goals that were sent out with a timestamp equal to or before the specified time.

Parameters:
time - A point in time.

cancelAllGoals

public void cancelAllGoals()
Cancels the execution of all goals.

stopTrackingGoal

public void stopTrackingGoal()
Stops tracking of the current goal without canceling it.

getResult

public T_RESULT getResult()
                                   throws RosException
Gets the result associated with the current goal. In order to check if a result message is available the goal state received from calling getState() should be SimpleClientGoalState.StateEnum#SUCCEEDED.

Returns:
The result message received from the action server or NULL if no result message was received.
Throws:
RosException

getState

public SimpleClientGoalState getState()
Gets the current goal state. Possible states are:
  • PENDING
  • ACTIVE
  • REJECTED
  • PREEMPTED
  • SUCCEEDED
  • ABORTED
  • LOST

Returns:
The current goal state

setSimpleState

protected void setSimpleState(SimpleGoalState.StateEnum nextState)
Sets the simplified goal state. This is used internally in the transitionCallback(ClientGoalHandle) method. It is the waitForResult() method that relies on this reduced set of goal states. The simplified states are:
  • PENDING
  • ACTIVE
  • DONE

Parameters:
nextState - A new simplified goal state

waitForServer

public void waitForServer()
                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Waits for the action server to start up.

Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

waitForServer

public boolean waitForServer(long timeout,
                             java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit units)
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Waits up to the specified duration for the action server to start up. If no connection could be established within the given time, the method returns indicating the error.

Parameters:
timeout - The maximum duration to wait for the action server to start up. A zero length duration results in unlimited waiting.
units - Units of timeout
Returns:
true - if the SimpleActionClient could establish a connection to the action server within the given time
false - otherwise
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

waitForResult

public void waitForResult()
                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Waits for the action server to successfully send the final result to this SimpleActionClient or the transition to another final state. This happens when the goal was recalled, rejected, preempted, aborted or lost.

Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

waitForResult

public boolean waitForResult(long timeout,
                             java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit units)
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Waits up to the specified duration for the action server to successfully send the final result to this SimpleActionClient or the transition to another final state. This happens when the goal was recalled, rejected, preempted, aborted or lost.

Parameters:
timeout - The maximum duration to wait for the action server to reach a final goal state. A zero length duration results in unlimited waiting.
units - Units for the timeout.
Returns:
true - If a final state is reached within the given time
false - Otherwise
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

feedbackCallback

public void feedbackCallback(ClientGoalHandle<T_ACTION_FEEDBACK,T_ACTION_GOAL,T_ACTION_RESULT,T_FEEDBACK,T_GOAL,T_RESULT> goalHandle,
                             T_FEEDBACK feedback)
Description copied from interface: ActionClientCallbacks
Gets called when the action client receives a feedback message from the action server. The implementation of this method should not contain any time-consuming operations and return immediately.

Specified by:
feedbackCallback in interface ActionClientCallbacks<T_ACTION_FEEDBACK extends Message,T_ACTION_GOAL extends Message,T_ACTION_RESULT extends Message,T_FEEDBACK extends Message,T_GOAL extends Message,T_RESULT extends Message>
Parameters:
goalHandle - A goal handle of an active goal that caused the feedback
feedback - The received feedback message
